programme.title: Snakes In The City

programme.title: Killer Safari
programme.desc: Lions kill four buffaloes in a stampede, while in another drying river a buffalo fights off five of the big cats. As the dry winter looms, heading out on a game drive means checking in at all the remaining waterholes. This is where the action plays out. Each event is unpacked and explained, offering a highly charged, emotional and informative ride.

programme.title: Trials Of The Wild
programme.desc: Life is risky, and no stage of life is riskier than the very beginning. Most animals are born frail, vulnerable, and with a lot of learning to do. But life doesn't go easy on the newcomers..

programme.title: Trials Of The Wild
programme.desc: A deadly predator is stalking the forests of Costa Rica. No, it's not a jaguar, it's a super organism made up of half a million tiny individuals -- an army ant colony..

programme.title: Predator V Prey
programme.desc: A forensic look at how lions hunt large prey like buffalo and zebra, offering new perspectives on the way these predators stalk, chase and kill. A lone lioness relies on cunning to feed her newborn cubs, whilst a fearless pride tries to take down the biggest prey of all, a giant African elephant. .

programme.title: Wild South Africa
programme.desc: Nowhere else on earth do Africa and Antarctica so impressively come together as at South Africa's Cape! It's a place where cold-loving penguins live alongside desert-dwelling ostriches, and which is similarly home to surfing sea snails and live-bearing chameleons.

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: Get ready to rumble! From brawling birds to hurting hooves, the vets swing into action mending paws, jaws, even a down on his luck duck. Doc wages an epic battle to save a cow struggling to give birth, Dr. Lisa treats a Husky hit by a truck, and Dr. Nicole examines a pack of puppies with a plethora of problems. The Pols welcome their newest fur baby, Christy, a rambunctious Bengal kitten.

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: Beloved clinic house cat, Tater, falls ill and the team bands together to save him. Charles debuts a new look, Dr. Pol treats a wood-chewing steer, and Dr. Brenda looks after a lab with stomach issues. A nosey Chihuahua eats a poisonous snack, so Dr. Lisa dispenses a messy antidote and Dr. Nicole jumps in to rescue a mama goat in labor.

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: Surprises come in all scrapes and sizes. A cockatiel has a tweaked beak and Dr. Lisa ponders a barn cats bladder leak. When a Chihuahua arrives after hours with an eye emergency, Doc remains focused. A serious blemish surfaces on a show dog and a hoarse horse struggles to breathe. Everyone comes together to make Dianes birthday extra special.

programme.title: Day Of The Dragon
programme.desc: The clock starts just before sunrise - when the temperature begins to rise. It‚Äôs hard work being the world‚Äôs biggest lizard on Rinca island. Competition is so fierce he can‚Äôt afford to slow down. For the biggest male on the island, an ever- warming environment and shrinking hunting grounds threaten his survival across every hour of the day.

programme.title: Killer Shark Vs. Killer Whale
programme.desc: Killer Shark vs. Killer Whale examined an extraordinary incident that occurred at the Farallon Islands, 27 miles off San Francisco, in October 1997. Two killer whales attacked and drowned a great white shark and ripped out its liver. The incident left biologists mystified. Since then there have been more attacks internationally. What is happening between the two apex predators of the oceans?

programme.title: Supersized Sharks
programme.desc: Has a small island in the middle of the South Pacific become a drive-thru burger joint for the world‚Äôs largest Tiger Sharks? Luring the giants to their boat, shark biologists Lauren Meyers, Charlie Huveneers and Adam Barnette investigate and are surprised to discover that beef is not the only unusual item on the menu.

programme.title: Jaguars Vs. Crocs
programme.desc: Veteran wildlife photographer Steve Winter and cameraman Bertie Gregory capture the remarkable lives of Jaguars in the Pantanal of Brazil. A mother jaguar teaches her cub survival while a determined male jaguar named Scarface dives headfirst into the river to tackle the deadliest of opponents - 6-foot long caiman. Clever capybaras and playful giant otters stick with their family members to avoid being jaguar dinner.

programme.title: World's Deadliest: Whale
programme.desc: Intelligent, cultured and deadly, the killer whale dominates every ocean on earth and as our planet changes, this top predator changes with it. They are elite, marine hunters with an extremely diverse diet including other apex predators like the great white shark. Killer whales pursue their prey like a pack of wolves and have multiple killing techniques. .

programme.title: World's Deadliest
programme.desc: Some of the deadliest predators in the animal kingdom owe their success to the fact that they don't kill alone. World's Deadliest: Packs and Swarms takes a deep dive into the world of group predation with a look at twelve different species that use teamwork to hunt more effectively than they otherwise would be able to alone. .

programme.title: World's Deadliest
programme.desc: Among animals, battles are often a zero-sum game. In just about every struggle, there's a winner and a loser, and the stakes are often life or death. The motives for combat are varied, but they usually boil down to this: food, territory, and sex. World's Deadliest: Battles looks at the epic struggles that ensue when predators seek to make a meal out of their prey‚Ä¶.

programme.title: World's Deadliest
programme.desc: World's Deadliest: Super Powers focuses on the fantastic. The creatures take everyday abilities to the extreme‚Ä¶ and some have powers far removed from the usual. In the battle of life and death, these animals have a wild card‚Ä¶ and they use it to the detriment of their foes.
